item.title: A.P.J. Abdul Kalam, Ex-President Who Pushed a Nuclear India, Dies at 83
item.description: Nicknamed “the Missile Man of India,” Dr. Kalam was one of his country’s most beloved figures for his role in advancing its nuclear program.
item.dc:creator: ELLEN BARRY
item.media:description: A.P.J. Abdul Kalam in 2006. Dr. Kalam, the president of India from 2002 to 2007, strongly supported its nuclear program.

item.title: Memo From Beijing: Ethnic Tensions in Xinjiang Complicate China-Turkey Ties
item.description: Bilateral trade is growing between Beijing and Ankara, but anti-Chinese sentiment in Turkey appears to be growing as well.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees
item.dc:creator: EDWARD WONG
item.media:description: Turkish nationalists burned a Chinese flag in front of the Chinese Consulate in Istanbul during a protest earlier this month to denounce China's treatment of ethnic Uighur Muslims.

item.title: Obama Says ‘I Could Win’ 3rd Term as President
item.description: The president said, “There’s a lot that I’d like to do to keep America moving forward.” But he also said he would be glad to return to private life.
item.dc:creator: PETER BAKER

item.title: Contributing Op-Ed Writer: What Does Islam Say About Being Gay?
item.description: The hostility of many Muslims toward homosexuality has little basis in the Quran.
item.dc:creator: MUSTAFA AKYOL

item.title: Taliban Make Gains Across 3 Provinces in Afghanistan
item.description: Over 100 police officers and other security personnel in the north have surrendered to the militants in the campaign, and scores of others have retreated.
item.dc:creator: JOSEPH GOLDSTEIN

item.title: At War Blog: Lt. Col. Kate Germano on the Marines and Women
item.description: Colonel Germano was relieved of command at Parris Island in June under circumstances that remain contentious, and then the Marine Corps Gazette decided not to print an article of hers that had been scheduled. It is now printed here.
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
item.dc:creator: C. J. CHIVERS
item.media:description: Lt. Col. Kate Germano, who took command of the Marine Corps’ all-women boot camp, was . The Corps said her Marines had been mistreated; she said her ability to command had been undermined.

item.title: Son of Muammar el-Qaddafi Sentenced to Death in Libya
item.description: Seif al-Islam el-Qaddafi was sentenced in absentia because he is being held captive by a militia in the country’s northwest; eight other ex-officials were sentenced to death.
item.dc:creator: DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK
item.media:description: Seif al-Islam el-Qaddafi, a son of Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi, in a courtroom in Zintan, Libya, in 2014.

item.title: Op-Ed Contributor: A New Approach for South Sudan
item.description: To avert a catastrophic famine, Washington must start talks to weaken the warring parties’ military capacity and broker a humanitarian cease-fire.
item.dc:creator: ANDREW S. NATSIOS

item.title: Litvinenko Poisoning Inquiry Nears End as Russian Refuses to Testify
item.description: The move by Dmitri V. Kovtun, a former Soviet Army officer, clears the way for final statements before the judge prepares a report on the ex-K.G.B. officer’s death.
item.dc:creator: ALAN COWELL

item.title: Op-Ed Contributor: Greece’s Relentless Exodus
item.description: Greeks are taking advantage of the European Union’s free movement of labor, and Germany is one of the main destinations.
item.dc:creator: JAMES ANGELOS

item.title: Escalator Death in China Sets Off Furor Online
item.description: The outrage that followed the death of a 31-year-old mother at a mall shows the growing power of Chinese to use social media to spotlight injustices.
item.dc:creator: JAVIER C. HERNÁNDEZ
item.media:description: An image from closed-circuit television showing Xiang Liujuan and her son as a panel at the top of the escalator gave way.

item.title: Malaysia’s Premier Dismisses Deputy and Attorney General Amid Scandal
item.description: The cabinet reshuffle came two days after the deputy called on Prime Minister Najib Razak to answer questions about a heavily indebted government-run fund.
item.dc:creator: AUSTIN RAMZY
item.media:description: Prime Minister Najib Razak of Malaysia, right, with his new deputy, Ahmad Zahid Hamidi, after a cabinet reshuffle in Putrajaya on Tuesday.

item.title: John Sewel Resigns From British House of Lords Amid Sex and Drug Scandal
item.description: After a newspaper reported that he had used cocaine with prostitutes, Lord Sewel gave up his seat, apologizing for the “pain and embarrassment” he had caused.
item.dc:creator: STEPHEN CASTLE
item.media:credit: British Parliament, via European Pressphoto Agency
item.media:description: John Sewel resigned his seat in the House of Lords on Tuesday.

item.title: Gay and Transgender Catholics Urge Pope Francis to Take a Stand
item.description: A large group seeks to meet the pope during his first visit to the United States, in September, to urge him to fully include gay and transgender Catholics in the church.
item.category: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
Gay and Lesbian Alliance Against Defamation
item.dc:creator: LAURIE GOODSTEIN
item.media:credit: Laura McDermott for The New York Times
item.media:description: Lui Akira Francesco Matsuo is among a large group of gay and transgender Catholics who are seeking a meeting with the pope during his first visit to the United States in September.

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: Q. and A.: Christopher K. Johnson on the Heavy Thumb of Xi Jinping
item.description: A senior adviser at the Center for Strategic and International Studies explains why he thinks President Xi Jinping is distinctly more powerful than his recent predecessors and is recasting the rules of Chinese politics.
item.category: Politburo Standing Committee of the Communist Party of China
item.dc:creator: CHRIS BUCKLEY
item.media:description: Christopher K. Johnson, a senior adviser at the Center for Strategic and International Studies.

item.title: Letter From Europe: Italy’s Influx of Immigrants Is a Domestic Problem, Too
item.description: Efforts to redistribute migrants across Italy, away from Sicily and other heavily affected southern regions, have run into stiff resistance.
item.dc:creator: CELESTINE BOHLEN

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: Q. and A.: Chen Zhonglin on ‘Picking Quarrels’ Online
item.description: Mr. Chen, a law professor at Chongqing University, discussed the meaning of “rule of law” and the uses and abuses of the charge of “picking quarrels and provoking trouble.”
item.dc:creator: ADAM WU
item.media:description: Chen Zhonglin, law professor at Chongqing University.

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: Rights Advocates, and a Monk, Oppose Beijing’s Winter Olympics Bid
item.description: Opponents of the effort by China are citing a widening crackdown on rights defense lawyers, political activists and ethnic minorities.
item.category: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
item.dc:creator: CHERIE CHAN and ANDREW JACOBS
item.media:description: Golog Jigme, an exiled Tibetan monk, has urged that Beijing not be awarded the 2022 Winter Games.

item.title: The Outlaw Ocean: A Renegade Trawler, Hunted for 10,000 Miles by Vigilantes
item.description: For 110 days and across two seas and three oceans, crews stalked a fugitive fishing ship considered the world’s most notorious poacher.
item.dc:creator: IAN URBINA
item.media:description: The Thunder, a trawler wanted for illegal fishing, was chased for 110 days and more than 10,000 nautical miles across two seas and three oceans, until it sunk in April.

item.title: Goals Diverge and Perils Remain as U.S. and Turkey Take on ISIS
item.description: The two countries will clear the Islamic State forces out of a 60-mile-long strip along the Turkish border, a major step toward increasing pressure on the militant group.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: ANNE BARNARD and MICHAEL R. GORDON
item.media:description: Residents in Istanbul's Gazi district on Monday carried the coffin of a militant who was killed Friday in clashes with the police.
